channel.title: Where to type my router IP
channel.description:
Ok, I was reading the very helpful tutorial, on making a moparscape server. When I got to this part:
"Now we will need to make the rule for your router, by doing this you need to go into your router. You can do this by going into Internet Explorer (or whatever client you use for the Internet), and then type in the IP address of the router. Now log into the router and go into "advanced" (at top of screen on mine). Then on the sidebar to the left click the "gaming" button (is only left side for me...) Then you need to make a new rule and fill in the blanks with this information:"
I got my IP, but where is it saying I should type it?
I saw this in FAQ:Go to file>>New Server>> and enter the IP.
But it isnt stating what the person who wrote the tut is saying.
Please tell me where to put my router IP, thanks!

item.title: Where to type my router IP
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

out it in where you would type in www.moparisthebest.com - in the url ba type in the ip you found

Read full topic
item.source: Where to type my router IP

item.title: Where to type my router IP
item.dc:creator: @rspoon rspoon
item.description:
@rspoon wrote:

Ok, I was reading the very helpful tutorial, on making a moparscape server. When I got to this part:

“Now we will need to make the rule for your router, by doing this you need to go into your router. You can do this by going into Internet Explorer (or whatever client you use for the Internet), and then type in the IP address of the router. Now log into the router and go into “advanced” (at top of screen on mine). Then on the sidebar to the left click the “gaming” button (is only left side for me…) Then you need to make a new rule and fill in the blanks with this information:”

I got my IP, but where is it saying I should type it?

I saw this in FAQ:Go to file>>New Server>> and enter the IP.

But it isnt stating what the person who wrote the tut is saying.

Please tell me where to put my router IP, thanks!

Read full topic
